verses.devanagari:
अग्न आ याहि वीतये गृणानो हव्यदातये।
नि होता सत्सि बर्हिषि ॥१॥
verses.iast:
agna ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇāno havyadātaye
ni hotā satsi barhiṣi
verses.translation: O Agni, come to the offering, praised, to receive the oblation; be seated as the Hotar upon the sacred grass.

verses.devanagari:
त्वमग्ने यज्ञानां होता विश्वेषां हितः।
देवेभिर्मानुषे जने ॥२॥
verses.iast:
tvam agne yajñānāṃ hotā viśveṣāṃ hitaḥ
devebhir mānuṣe jane
verses.translation: You, Agni, are the priest of sacrifices, a helper of all—among gods and among men.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निं दूतं वृणीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम्।
अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रम् ॥३॥
verses.iast:
agniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam
asya yajñasya sukratum
verses.translation: We choose Agni as messenger, the all-knowing Hotar, skillful in this sacrifice.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निर्वृत्राणि जङ्घनद्द्रविणस्युर्विपन्यया।
समिद्धः शुक्र आहुतः ॥४॥
verses.iast:
agnir vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad draviṇasyur vipanyayā
samiddhaḥ śukra āhutaḥ
verses.translation: Agni, bestower of riches, smites the foes with skill; when kindled and bright, duly offered.

verses.devanagari:
प्रेष्ठं वो अतिथिं स्तुषे मित्रमिव प्रियम्।
अग्ने रथं न वेद्यम् ॥५॥
verses.iast:
preṣṭhaṃ vo atithiṃ stuṣe mitram iva priyam
agne rathaṃ na vedyam
verses.translation: I praise the dearest guest, like a beloved friend—Agni, swift as a chariot upon the sacred ground.

verses.devanagari:
त्वं नो अग्ने महोभिः पाहि विश्वस्या अरातेः।
उत द्विषो मर्त्यस्य ॥६॥
verses.iast:
tvaṃ no agne mahobhiḥ pāhi viśvasyā arāteḥ
uta dviṣo martyasya
verses.translation: Protect us, O Agni, with your great powers from all hostility—and from the hatred of mortal men.

verses.devanagari:
एह्यू षु ब्रवाणि तेऽग्न इत्थेतरा गिरः।
एभिर्वर्धास इन्दुभिः ॥७॥
verses.iast:
ehy ūṣu bravāṇi te 'gna itthetarā giraḥ
ebhir vardhāsa indubhiḥ
verses.translation: Come—let me speak diverse hymns to you, Agni; with these libations may you grow in strength.

verses.devanagari:
आ ते वत्सो मनो यमत्परमाच्चित्सधस्थात्।
अग्ने त्वां कामये गिरा ॥८॥
verses.iast:
ā te vatso mano yamat paramāc cit sadhasthāt
agne tvāṃ kāmaye girā
verses.translation: To you the mind comes, as a calf to its dam, from the highest seat; O Agni, I yearn for you with song.

verses.devanagari:
त्वामग्ने पुष्करादध्यथर्वा निरमन्थत।
मूर्ध्नो विश्वस्य वाघतः ॥९॥
verses.iast:
tvām agne puṣkarād adhy atharvā niramanthata
mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ
verses.translation: Atharvan churned you forth, O Agni, from the lotus (wood), from the head—the summit—of the universe.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने विवस्वदा भरास्मभ्यमूतये महे।
देवो ह्यसि नो दृशे ॥१०॥
verses.iast:
agne vivasvadā bharāsmabhyam ūtaye mahe
devo hy asi no dṛśe
verses.translation: Agni, by Vivasvat’s (gift) bring us great help; for you are a god, visible to us.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि।
स इद्देवेषु गच्छति ॥१॥
verses.iast:
agne yaṃ yajñam adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi
sa id deveṣu gacchati
verses.translation: O Agni, the sacrifice and rite you guard on every side—indeed that goes to the gods.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने त्वमसि होता सचा देवान् ऋतावृधः।
यज्ञस्य पुरोहितः ॥२॥
verses.iast:
agne tvam asi hotā sacā devān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
yajñasya purohitaḥ
verses.translation: You are the Hotar, O Agni—advancing the gods, the purohita of the sacrifice, grown strong by sacred order.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निं स्तोमेभिरा वसं वनेषु शश्वतीरिषः।
नरः सुदीति दीदिहि ॥३॥
verses.iast:
agniṃ stomebhir ā vasaṃ vaneṣu śaśvatīr iṣaḥ
naraḥ sudīti dīdihi
verses.translation: With chants bring Agni, the wealth-bringer; O men, let him shine forth in the woods with everlasting nourishments.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निर्होता न्यसदद् वसुर्यज्ञस्य निष्ठितः।
विप्रः कवेन्द्र ईड्यः ॥४॥
verses.iast:
agnir hotā ny asadad vasur yajñasya niṣṭhitaḥ
vipraḥ kavendra īḍyaḥ
verses.translation: Agni, the Hotar, has sat down—the benefactor fixed for the rite, the inspired seer and praiseworthy lord of poets.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने यक्षि त्वमिन्दुभिर् हव्या जुह्वा सुष्टुति।
देवाँ उशन् हुवेम ते ॥५॥
verses.iast:
agne yakṣi tvam indubhir havyā juhvā suṣṭuti
devāṃ uśan huvema te
verses.translation: Worship, O Agni, with libations; with the ladle well-praised offer the oblations; with you we call the gods.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने बृहद्भिर्महद्भिर् इळया याति नो गृहम्।
सूनुḥ सहस्रवर्चसः ॥६॥
verses.iast:
agne bṛhadbhir mahadbhir iḷayā yāti no gṛham
sūnuḥ sahasravarcasaḥ
verses.translation: With lofty, mighty praises and refreshment he comes to our home—Agni, the son of thousandfold brilliance.

verses.devanagari:
उत नो अग्ने सुवीरा स्तविष्ठा रयिमाशाः।
धा नः सन्तु प्रचेतसः ॥७॥
verses.iast:
uta no agne suvīrā staviṣṭhā rayim āśāḥ
dhā naḥ santu pracetasaḥ
verses.translation: And, O Agni, let there be to us wealth with brave men; may our hopes be upheld by the wise.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने भद्रा नि ते गिरोऽश्विना वा सुवृक्तिभिः।
इन्द्रं वर्धन्तु सूक्तिभिः ॥८॥
verses.iast:
agne bhadrā ni te giro 'śvinā vā suvṛktibhiḥ
indraṃ vardhantu sūktibhiḥ
verses.translation: May auspicious hymns be set for you, O Agni; or with well-made verses may they magnify Indra and the Aśvins.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने शुचि श्रावय वाचं देवान् हविषा वयम्।
आ वो यज्ञं तनूमहि ॥९॥
verses.iast:
agne śuci śrāvaya vācaṃ devān haviṣā vayam
ā vo yajñaṃ tanūmahi
verses.translation: Pure Agni, make our speech heard; with oblation we call the gods—come, let us extend the sacrifice to you.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने मित्रो न शंस्यः प्रीणाय सुमनाः भवा।
नः त्रातारं हवामहे ॥१०॥
verses.iast:
agne mitro na śaṃsyaḥ prīṇāya sumanāḥ bhavā
naḥ trātāraṃ havāmahe
verses.translation: Be, O Agni, as a friend worthy of praise, well-disposed for our delight; we invoke you as our protector.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान्।
विश्वानि देव वैरणानि विद्वान्॥
verses.iast:
agne naya supathā rāye asmān
viśvāni deva vairāṇāni vidvān
verses.translation: O Agni, lead us by the good path to prosperity, O god, knowing all struggles.

verses.devanagari:
यजस्व होतः प्रया वाचा।
अग्ने देवाँ इह वह नि षीद॥
verses.iast:
yajasva hotaḥ prayā vācā
agne devāñ iha vaha ni ṣīda
verses.translation: Perform the rite, O Hotar; O Agni, bring the gods here and sit down.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निर्नः पातु दुरितात् पुरःप्रजान्।
उद्गातृभिर् हव्यवाहो नमोभिः॥
verses.iast:
agnir naḥ pātu duritāt puraḥ-prajān
udgātṛbhir havyavāho namobhiḥ
verses.translation: May Agni, the oblation-carrier, protect us and our people from trouble, with the chants of the singers and our reverence.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने मित्रो न शोभसे शुचिः।
देवो देवान् यजसि यज्ञियान्॥
verses.iast:
agne mitro na śobhase śuciḥ
devo devān yajasi yajñiyān
verses.translation: O Agni, bright and pure, you shine like a friend; a god, you worship the worshipful gods.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने मनुर्भव वसुर् वीतिहोत्रा।
गृणानो रत्नधरः सूर्यस्य॥
verses.iast:
agne manur bhava vasur vītihotrā
gṛṇāno ratnadharaḥ sūryasya
verses.translation: Be our Manu-like leader, O Agni, a benefactor at the rite, praised, bearer of treasures beneath the sun.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने वह समिधा देवान्।
इह प्र याहि सुक्रतू यजत्र॥
verses.iast:
agne vaha samidhā devān
iha pra yāhi sukratū yajatra
verses.translation: Bring the gods with the kindling, O Agni; come here, skillful and worship-worthy.

verses.devanagari:
यं त्वा धिया सुष्टुतिं वर्धयाम।
अग्ने अस्मे रयिं भूयसीम् दा॥
verses.iast:
yaṃ tvā dhiyā suṣṭutiṃ vardhayāma
agne asme rayiṃ bhūyasīm dā
verses.translation: As we exalt you with clear thought and fair praise, O Agni, grant us abundant wealth.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने तव श्रवो बृहत् सुवीरम्।
तुभ्यं दध्मो वचो वाजयन्तम्॥
verses.iast:
agne tava śravo bṛhat suvīram
tubhyaṃ dadhmo vaco vājayantam
verses.translation: Great is your renown, O Agni, bringing brave men; to you we utter strength-winning speech.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने प्रःणो बृहन्न् इह सादि।
विश्वानि पाहि सुक्रतो गृहे अस्मिन्॥
verses.iast:
agne praḥṇo bṛhann iha sādi
viśvāni pāhi sukrato gṛhe asmin
verses.translation: Mighty and vast Agni, be seated here; protect all things in this house, O skillful one.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने देवान् उप वहा हविष्मान्।
अस्मभ्यं द्युम्नं रयिम् अश्वसातिम्॥
verses.iast:
agne devān upa vahā haviṣmān
asmabhyaṃ dyumnaṃ rayim aśva-sātim
verses.translation: Bring the gods near with the oblation, O Agni; for us win splendor, wealth, and rich steeds.
